text: [Music]
I've been working in music I've been
playing since I was a kid uh but in the
industry itself the first record I ever
played on that was a major record was
Lauren Hills album The miseducation of
Lauren Hill back in 1998 I was still in
in college at University of Pennsylvania
I had a friend who was a friend of
Lawrence and she introduced me to her uh
this was after the success of the score
by the food
and so Lauren was a big star and
everyone was anticipating her solo album
and uh I went to the studio with them
one day and just hung out and uh she uh
heard me sing I played a couple songs
for her and she thought I sounded good
and wanted me to play piano on the track
she was working on so I did it I played
on it and uh she liked what I did and uh
she kept it on the album song was called
Everything is Everything which was a
pretty big hit back in 9899
and uh I was just really proud to be a
part of such an important album and that
was my first entry into the the big time
the big leagues uh of the music business
but it was just a session I just played
the piano and that was that um as I
progressed as a writer and as a singer I
worked with different producers some in
Philly some in New York and uh I put a
couple different variations of my band
together and I just kept trying to get a
record de
uh I would play at local clubs in New
York and Philadelphia sometimes Atlanta
sometimes DC just trying to get some
buzz and building an audience and it
kept building and building uh a couple
years into me living in New York I met
Kanye West who at the time was still an
unknown producer from Chicago who had
just moved out to the east coast he was
the uh he is the cousin of uh one of my
good friends Devon Harris who uh is also
a producer and and one of my classmates
from college and uh we started working
together Kanye and I and I think that
was the biggest uh uh Difference Maker
in my career uh when I started working
with him his star was just starting to
ascend and uh uh I kind of hitched on to
that and uh his uh Ascension really
helped me get noticed by the right
people and we made some really cool
music together him and I uh on his
project and uh also on my own project
and other people's projects like slum
Village Alicia Keys Jay-Z all these
things were happening before I got a
record deal and they were helping me get
the buzz and the energy around my
project that I needed to get a record
deal and finally in 2004 I signed with
Sony through Kanye's imprint and uh I
released my first album get lifted in
December of 2004
you it really hasn't changed a lot uh we
were never close friends uh in the
beginning it was more of a professional
relationship that developed into a
friendship and we're still friends and
we still you know joke around the same
way we did before we still work together
in this similar way that we did before
and I think we still have a respect for
each other's creativity uh that we did
before and uh I I believe Kanye is one
of the most important creative minds in
music right now and I'm excited to still
be able to work with him
